**Security-relevant JAR versions flagged for audit follow-up:**

- `commons-fileupload-1.1.jar` -- very old (2004); multiple known CVEs including unrestricted file upload
- `commons-collections-3.1.jar` -- CVE-2015-6420 Java deserialization gadget chain; HIGH severity
- `httpclient-4.2.3.jar` / `httpcore-4.2.2.jar` -- old releases; multiple CVEs
- `itextpdf-5.4.2.jar` -- AGPL license; 2013 release; review licensing and CVE history
- `postgresql-8.3-603.jdbc4.jar` -- JDBC driver for PostgreSQL 8.3 (EOL since 2013)
- `poi-3.9-20121203.jar` -- 2012 release; multiple CVEs including XXE
- `dom4j-1.6.1.jar` -- CVE-2018-1000632, CVE-2020-10683
- `log4j-api-2.17.0.jar` / `log4j-core-2.17.0.jar` -- version 2.17.0 is patched for Log4Shell (CVE-2021-44228)
- `javamelody.jar` -- monitoring servlet; version undetermined; may expose internal metrics
- `esapi-2.5.3.1.jar` -- relatively recent; review configuration in ESAPI.properties
- Duplicate classpath JARs present:
  - commons-logging: both commons-logging.jar (v1.1) and commons-logging-1.1.1.jar (v1.1.1)
  - commons-net: both commons-net-1.4.1.jar and commons-net-2.0.jar

None found in the repository.

None found in the repository.

Only 2 .class files found -- located in the Tomcat JSP compilation work directory:

```
work/org/apache/jsp/pages/admin/setting/driver_005flimiting_005fby_005ftruck_jsp.class  (39K)
work/org/apache/jsp/pages/admin/setting/driver_005fsettings_005fto_005funit_jsp.class   (39K)
```

These are Tomcat-compiled JSP artifacts in work/org/apache/jsp/ -- standard Tomcat work
directory output. No pre-compiled .class files from Java source are present in the repository.

## 5. All Configuration Files

### WEB-INF Configuration Files

```
WEB-INF/web.xml                            (primary servlet deployment descriptor)
WEB-INF/web - Copy.xml                     (stale backup of web.xml committed to repo)
WEB-INF/taglibs-mailer.tld                (tag library descriptor -- mailer)
WEB-INF/taglibs-request.tld               (tag library descriptor -- request)
WEB-INF/src/ESAPI.properties              (ESAPI security framework configuration)
WEB-INF/src/esapi-java-logging.properties (ESAPI logging configuration)
WEB-INF/src/log4j.properties              (Log4j 1.x configuration -- legacy)
WEB-INF/src/log4j2.properties             (Log4j 2.x configuration)
WEB-INF/src/validation.properties         (ESAPI input validation rules)
```

**web.xml notes:**
- Servlet spec version: 3.0 (http://java.sun.com/xml/ns/javaee/web-app_3_0.xsd)
- Application description: Linde Fleet Management SYSTEM
- File encoding: ISO-8859-1
- WEB-INF/web - Copy.xml is a stale backup committed to version control -- should be removed

**No context.xml in repository** -- DB connection config is not in VCS (correct; expected in
Tomcat server conf/ or per-app META-INF/).

**No server.xml in repository** -- Tomcat server configuration is externalized.

## 6. Build System Identification

| Build File | Found? | Location |
|------------|--------|----------|
| pom.xml (Maven) | No | -- |
| build.xml (Ant) | No | -- |
| build.gradle (Gradle) | No | -- |
| Makefile | Partial only | js/flot/Makefile (JavaScript library -- not the Java app) |

**Conclusion: No Java build system found -- IDE-only build (Eclipse).**

Evidence:
- .classpath at repository root -- standard Eclipse Java EE project configuration
- .tomcatplugin at repository root -- Eclipse Tomcat Plugin descriptor (webPath: auReskinProject)
- .settings/ directory -- Eclipse workspace settings
- Source output path: WEB-INF/classes (configured in .classpath)
- CATALINA_HOME/lib/ classpath variable references (resolved by Eclipse Tomcat Plugin)
- No Maven, Gradle, or Ant build descriptors for the Java application

The application is built and deployed directly from Eclipse IDE using the Eclipse Tomcat Plugin.
No CI/CD pipeline is evident from repository contents.

---

## 7. Tomcat Version Identification

| Source | Finding |
|--------|---------|
| server.xml | Not present in repository |
| Tomcat JARs in WEB-INF/lib/ | None found |
| .tomcatplugin | Present; webPath = auReskinProject; no version number recorded |
| .classpath | References CATALINA_HOME/lib/: jasper-el.jar, jasper.jar, jsp-api.jar, servlet-api.jar, mail.jar |
| web.xml | Servlet spec 3.0 -- Tomcat 7.x or later required |
| work/ directory | org/apache/jsp/ path confirms Tomcat JSP work directory |

**Conclusion:** Tomcat is confirmed as the application container. Servlet spec 3.0 requires
minimum Tomcat 7.0. Exact Tomcat version is **not determinable from repository contents** and
must be verified on the deployment server via CATALINA_HOME/lib/catalina.jar manifest or startup logs.

## 10. Binary Artifacts in Version Control Assessment

**Pre-compiled Java .class files (from Java source):** NONE FOUND.

**Tomcat JSP-compiled .class files:** 2 FILES in work/ directory.

```
work/org/apache/jsp/pages/admin/setting/driver_005flimiting_005fby_005ftruck_jsp.class  (39K)
work/org/apache/jsp/pages/admin/setting/driver_005fsettings_005fto_005funit_jsp.class   (39K)
```

These are Tomcat-generated JSP compilation artifacts. Their presence in version control is a
hygiene issue -- they should be excluded via .gitignore.

**WAR files:** NONE FOUND.

**Summary:** WEB-INF/classes/ (Eclipse compilation output) is absent from the repository.
The two .class files in work/ are Tomcat runtime artifacts only.

**Recommendation:** Add work/ to .gitignore.

## 11. Files That May Contain Secrets

### .properties Files (all paths)

```
WEB-INF/src/ESAPI.properties
WEB-INF/src/esapi-java-logging.properties
WEB-INF/src/log4j.properties
WEB-INF/src/log4j2.properties
WEB-INF/src/validation.properties
```

| File | Risk Level | Notes |
|------|-----------|-------|
| WEB-INF/src/ESAPI.properties | HIGH | Encryptor.MasterKey and Encryptor.MasterSalt fields present. May contain actual cryptographic key material. Must be reviewed immediately. |
| WEB-INF/src/esapi-java-logging.properties | LOW | ESAPI logging config; unlikely to contain secrets |
| WEB-INF/src/log4j.properties | LOW-MEDIUM | Log4j 1.x; may contain SMTP credentials if email appender configured |
| WEB-INF/src/log4j2.properties | LOW-MEDIUM | Log4j 2.x; same risk |
| WEB-INF/src/validation.properties | LOW | Input validation regex rules; no expected secrets |

### context.xml

**Not present in repository.** Correct practice -- DB credentials expected in Tomcat
conf/context.xml on the deployment server, not in version control.

### Files with Secret/Password/Credential/Key in Filename

| File | Type | Risk |
|------|------|------|
| WEB-INF/src/.../util/PasswordExpiryAlert.java | Java source | Alert scheduling logic; no hardcoded secrets expected |
| WEB-INF/src/.../util/password_life.java | Java source | Password lifecycle policy; no hardcoded secrets expected |
| WEB-INF/src/.../util/password_policy.java | Java source | Password policy rules; no hardcoded secrets expected |
| pages/admin/setting/change_password.jsp | JSP | Password change UI -- review for IDOR vulnerability |
| reports/alert_password_expiry.jsp | JSP | Expiry alert display -- no secrets |
| images/linde/password.png | Image | UI icon -- not a secret |

Note: Many key and keyword filename matches refer to the KeyHourUtil report (key-hour vehicle
utilisation metric) and keyword search filter JSPs. These contain no cryptographic key material.

### Additional Secret Risk: Hardcoded Credentials in Java Source

The DAO package (WEB-INF/src/com/torrent/surat/fms6/dao/) likely contains JDBC connection logic.
With no context.xml in-repo and an IDE-only build, there is a risk that database credentials are
hardcoded in Java source (common in older Eclipse-built Java EE applications).

**Pass 2 agents must search Java source for:**
- Hardcoded JDBC URLs, usernames, and passwords in DAO classes
- Database hostname/port literals in service/repository classes
- API keys or bearer tokens in integration classes
- SMTP credentials in utility/alert email classes

### Summary: Highest-Priority Secret Risks for Pass 2

1. WEB-INF/src/ESAPI.properties -- review Encryptor.MasterKey / Encryptor.MasterSalt values
2. WEB-INF/src/com/torrent/surat/fms6/dao/ -- grep for hardcoded JDBC credentials
3. WEB-INF/src/log4j.properties / log4j2.properties -- check SMTPAppender credentials
4. WEB-INF/web.xml -- check for inline resource / env-entry with credential values
